image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: A do not cross police crime scene tape strewn across a suburban road

props.synopsis: A 51-year-old Seaton man has been charged with manslaughter after police say they were called to a fight on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Man dies, another charged after alleged fight in Adelaide's western suburbs, police say

image.altText: A dancer in Pina Bausch work Café Müller. In a nightdress, she wraps her arms around her body, eyes emotively closed

props.synopsis: A dance masterpiece never seen in Australian before — except on grainy video recordings — is about to be performed. It's been described as a life-changing work of art.

title.children: Eyes closed, stumbling, naked: These dancers are like nothing you've seen

image.altText: A dried up dam with cracked soil and little water

props.synopsis: Children are skipping school because families are running out of water to shower or wash uniforms, a South Australian mayor says amid record dry weather in the state.

title.children: 'Dirty uniforms': Families in Adelaide's south face water shortages

image.altText: An office building facing a suburban road.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway into the handling of grant funding by past management at one of South Australia's largest disability advocacy services.

title.children: Disability advocacy service under investigation, clients told to 'represent yourself'

image.altText: Lady with long brown hair, black dress and yellow rainbow earrings stares somber at the camera with a child memorial behind

props.synopsis: When Bronwyn Helgeson's five-year-old son died suddenly, she was left dealing with unimaginable grief and unexpected financial costs.

title.children: Australia 'behind the game' with helping families navigate child loss

image.altText: A man standing in front of a water truck.

props.synopsis: South Australia's farmers are worried about water supplies for livestock as drought conditions cause dams to dry up across the state.

title.children: Dry dams leave SA farmers deciding to buy water or sell livestock

image.altText: A man with grey hair and moustache lays in a hospital bed with a woman leaning down with her arm around him

props.synopsis: SA Health officials apologise to a man who waited 15 hours to be seen at an Adelaide emergency department after presenting with a suspected stroke.

title.children: 'It was awful': Man waits 15 hours in Adelaide hospital after suspected stroke

image.altText: A weather map showing the forecast rain for NSW and Queensland over a five-day period.

props.synopsis: With Tropical Cyclone Alfred nearing the coastline, here's a day-by-day outline of the impacts to expect on the ground in south-east Queensland and northern New South Wales.

title.children: A breakdown of what to expect from Tropical Cyclone Alfred in coming days

image.altText: pension money

props.synopsis: There will likely be a flurry of insurance claims lodged after Cyclone Alfred, so here's what the experts recommend you do before, during and after the storm to make sure you're protected.

title.children: How to give cyclone insurance claims the best chance of being approved

image.altText: A vet in blue scrubs looking at a sick dog.

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast animal surgery is stocked with extra generator fuel, clean water, plenty of food and even cushions for pet owners to camp out on, as the weather system approaches the coast.

title.children: Vet prepares mattresses for pet owners as Cyclone Alfred nears coast

image.altText: Two hands hold a piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: When the Reserve Bank cut the official cash rate last month, lenders reacted quickly, letting customers know home loan rates were dropping. But they've been slower to explain how the changes will affect savings rates. Here's what it could mean for you.

title.children: What's happened to savings rates after RBA interest rate cut?

image.altText: Lauren Willgoose walks alongside an older woman outside the court

props.synopsis: A former Adelaide lawyer who drank more than a litre of wine before fatally crashing into a pedestrian has been jailed for eight years.

title.children: Former lawyer jailed over hit-run that killed pedestrian

image.altText: An older man in a tshirt and shorts, with his hands on his hips, outside his family home.

props.synopsis: Other governments including Victoria and the ACT have stamp duty exemptions for pensioners who meet certain criteria. Now some retirees in NSW wish similar exemptions were available to them.

title.children: Stamp duty costs a growing issue for older downsizers

image.altText: A boy with an amputated arm wrapped up sits in an orange chair

props.synopsis: The ABC meets some of the children evacuated from the war-ravaged strip, seeking medical treatment in Jordan.

title.children: 'I am the only man left': 13yo wants to get well for his family

image.altText: The flags of the US, Canada and Mexico side by side

props.synopsis: The exemption, covering the two largest US trading partners, will expire on April 2.

title.children: Trump postpones 25pc tariffs on some goods from Canada and Mexico

image.altText: Ziad Basyouny next to a campaign sign, holding pamphlets.

props.synopsis: Egyptian-born doctor Ziad Basyouny's is frustrated — and now he's attempting to unseat one of the federal government's most senior figures in one of Labor's safest seats.

title.children: Gaza war was 'that straw on a big camel's back', says Burke challenger

image.altText: A composite image of Roger Cook and Libby Mettam

props.synopsis: Who's funding the WA state election? Which seats are in play? How could the opposition win? We dive into the numbers behind the WA state election.

title.children: Unveiling the shadow election campaign playing out in WA

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Illustration of a human silhouette with brain, injection pen and fast food.

props.synopsis: People on Ozempic and other GLP-1 agonist drugs commonly report they no longer have constant, incessant thoughts about food. This is how the drugs work.

title.children: How Ozempic works in the brain to help people lose weight

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: Australian shares fall sharply at the open. As Donald Trump delayed some tariffs on Mexican and Canadian goods, fatigue at the policy whiplash hit US markets. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wall St tumbles with Nasdaq down more than 10pc from peak, ASX drops

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Star Entertainment lost a substantial shareholder

image.altText: A woman wearing a face mask holds up white flowers and a portrait of anti-corruption lawyer Sergei Magnitsky at a protest in Mo

props.synopsis: Australia implemented Magnitsky-style laws in 2021 but critics say little has been done to sanction human rights abusers from the Asia-Pacific.

title.children: Australia criticised for selectively sanctioning rights-abusing countries

image.altText: Man and his son load sand into bags at Logan collection centre

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have visited sandbag collection areas across Logan just to help other residents.

title.children: Community rallies to help each other as Alfred looms

image.altText: A man gives a cow lying on the ground a drink of water from a water bottle.

props.synopsis: Dead and injured cattle from an overturned livestock truck were ignored by authorities for weeks while multiple state government agencies, councils, and insurance companies bickered over who was responsible.

title.children: Response to cattle truck rollover branded a bureaucratic 'balls-up'

image.altText: a skip bin with salmon carcasses

props.synopsis: With Tasmania's salmon companies reeling from unprecedented losses due to disease and warm weather, the industry is told it will face investigation by the Environment Protection Authority.

title.children: More than 5,500 tonnes of dead salmon dumped amid Tasmania's largest-ever losses

image.altText: AFL captains sit together for a photo, with the premiership cup between Lachie Neale and Callum Mills

props.synopsis: As a new footy season arrives, fresh with promise and hope for clubs and fans across the country, the AFL braces for a year set to be dominated by discussions of concussion, drugs and trade and free agency speculation.

title.children: The AFL braces for 2025, a season that could change the game forever

image.altText: The pope, dressed all in white, makes a blessing gesture with one hand.

props.synopsis: In the message, the pontiff thanked those at the service for their prayers and support.

title.children: Pope Francis releases audio message from hospital

image.altText: Barristers leaving a Queensland Supreme Court courtroom

props.synopsis: The Australian Law Reform Commission set out to try and address the strikingly low rate of reporting of sexual offences and even lower rates of prosecution and convictions.

title.children: Sweeping changes recommended for how sexual violence is handled by courts

image.altText: Participants of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade on Saturday, March 1, 2025

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The Oscars, a retiring cricket legend and Mardi Gras

image.altText: South Korean KF-16 fighter jets fly in the sky

props.synopsis: South Korea's Air Force say eight 225kg Mk82 bombs from KF-16 jets fell during military exercises in Pocheon.

title.children: South Korea air force jets accidentally drop bombs on homes

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: The estranged wife of AFL player Rick Olarenshaw and an Australian couple were arrested last year during separate raids on spas that Balinese police said were  "providing pornographic services".

title.children: Influencer and Aussie couple sentenced to seven months for illegal Bali spas

image.altText: Two Matildas players during a break in play at the SheBelieves Cup.

props.synopsis: On the back of a winless SheBelieves Cup campaign, the Matildas slip to their equal worst position in the history of the FIFA world rankings.

title.children: Struggling Matildas fall to lowest FIFA ranking in 20 years

image.altText: Victoria Azarenka pumps her fist at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: In a move welcomed by the likes of Victoria Azarenka, the Women's Tennis Association will offer players up to 12 months of paid maternity leave for the first time.

title.children: WTA announces 'first-of-its-kind' maternity benefits plan for players

image.altText: Rocky hills surrounding a flattish plain. The rocks and dirt are red. Small shrubs are scattered around.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 3.47-billion-year-old crater in WA's Pilbara region pushes back the age of the earliest-known impact site on Earth by more than one billion years.

title.children: Earth's oldest-known impact crater discovered in outback WA
